item.title: 欧盟挑选曾协助制定社交媒体规则的技术执法者
item.description: 欧盟拟任命的新数字主管是一位资深的芬兰立法者，她在制定约束大科技公司的规则方面发挥了核心作用，这将与她更张扬的前任形成鲜明对比，而她的前任已于一天前辞职以示抗议。【原文：The European Union’s proposed new digital chief is a veteran Finnish lawmaker who was central in crafting rules reining in Big Tech and will be a marked contrast to her more flamboyant predecessor, who resigned in protest a day earlier.】

item.title: 美国警告银行未经同意不得收取透支费
item.description: 消费者金融保护局告诫银行不要在未征得客户同意的情况下向客户收取透支费。【原文：The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau cautioned banks against extracting overdraft fees from customers without first obtaining their consent.】

item.title: 法国电网负责人称可再生能源必须帮助平衡电力网络
item.description: 法国电网负责人表示，如果可再生能源要继续快速扩张，风能和太阳能发电场就必须像其他发电机一样，全面参与电网平衡。【原文：France’s power-grid boss said wind and solar farms will have to fully participate in balancing the electricity network like other generators if renewables are to continue their rapid expansion.】

item.title: 价值型股票 ETF 在美联储削减前的轮动押注中获利数十亿美元
item.description: 投资者押注，一旦美联储开始降息，价值被低估的股票就会复苏。【原文：Investors are betting on a revival of undervalued stocks once the Federal Reserve starts cutting interest rates.】

item.title: Ex-Mastercard Executive Invests in Startup Pomelo, Joins Board
item.description: Carlo Enrico, the former Latin America and Caribbean regional head at Mastercard Inc., has invested in payment card startup Pomelo and will join the board.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Strikes $1 Billion Deal as Aluminum Drive Picks Up
item.description: Saudi Arabia has announced three deals in as many days as the oil-rich kingdom looks to accelerate the expansion of its metals and mining industry.

item.title: What Threat Do Yemen’s Houthi Rebels Pose to Israel?
item.description: Soon after war broke out in October between Israel and the militant Palestinian group Hamas, the Houthi rebels who control northwestern Yemen joined in. The Houthis, who like Hamas are hostile to Israel and backed by Iran, began disrupting traffic in the Red Sea by attacking ships there, provoking a military response led by the US and UK. The rebels also started flinging missiles and drones at Israel, which is separated from Yemen by about 1,500 kilometers (932 miles) at the closest point. They’

item.title: Dutch to Give Extra €19 Billion Loan to Capital-Strapped Tennet
item.description: The Dutch government will lend state-owned grid operator Tennet Holding BV another €19 billion ($21.1 billion) for its capital requirements after talks with Berlin over a sale of its German network failed.

item.title: Alternative-Investment Firm Launches Brazil Reforestation Fund
item.description: Patria Investments Ltd., one of Latin America’s biggest alternative-asset managers, is launching its first reforestation fund with a goal of raising $100 million.

item.title: Deutsche Bank Launches FX Service Targeting Medium-Sized Funds
item.description: Deutsche Bank AG is launching a new service aimed at facilitating foreign-exchange transactions for mid-sized asset managers, expanding its presence in an increasingly competitive market.

item.title: Intel Lands Amazon Chip Deal Amid Foundry Split, Plant Pullback
item.description: Intel Corp. has made a raft of announcements over the past 24 hours in an effort to prove that a turnaround for the troubled chipmaker is starting to bear fruit.

item.title: Is Western Sahara’s Frozen Conflict Nearing an End?
item.description: In 1975, colonial power Spain abandoned Western Sahara, and Morocco swooped in to claim the territory as its own. Some of the indigenous Sahrawi population rebelled against their new rulers, supported by Morocco’s neighbor Algeria.

item.title: Houston-Area Blaze Caused by SUV Hitting Pipeline, Officials Say
item.description: A fire on an Energy Transfer LP natural gas liquids pipeline near Houston was caused by an SUV crashing through the fence of a Walmart store and into an above-ground valve to the line, local officials said.

item.title: Credit Agricole Mulls Seeking Retail Deposit License in Spain
item.description: Credit Agricole SA is studying whether to apply for a retail deposit license in Spain for its consumer finance unit Sofinco, as a part of a plan to make it profitable.

item.title: Uber to Verify Passengers’ Identities as Part of Driver Safety Push
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. will begin checking passengers’ account information against third-party identity verification databases in an effort to make drivers feel safer.

item.title: Parched Fields Threaten Wheat Plantings in Key Black Sea Region
item.description: Dried out soils in Russia and Ukraine are threatening plantings for next year’s wheat harvest, yet another headache for farmers hit by weather setbacks and the ongoing war.

item.title: Philip Morris to Sell UK Inhaler Maker Vectura at a Loss
item.description: Philip Morris International Inc is selling Vectura Group Ltd. for roughly a third of the price it paid for the UK maker of asthma inhalers about three years ago.

item.title: RBC Names Ventura Head of US ECM, Passaro Head of Syndicate
item.description: Royal Bank of Canada named Mike Ventura as head of US equity capital markets in a flurry promotions by the bank.

item.title: Accenture to Delay Bulk of Promotions by Six Months on Outlook
item.description: Accenture Plc is planning to push back the bulk of its staff promotions by six months in the latest sign of a prolonged slump that’s hurt the wider consultancy industry.

item.title: SNB Should Distribute Profits Directly to Citizens, Study Says
item.description: The Swiss National Bank should distribute its profits directly among citizens in order to take politics out of the decision of how much it hands out, a Swiss pro-market think tank said.

item.title: Crypto VC Fund Dragonfly Seeking to Raise a $500 Million Fund
item.description: Crypto venture capital firm Dragonfly Capital is seeking to raise $500 million for its fourth fund, which will invest in early-stage projects, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

item.title: Dartmouth Kicks Off $500 Million Investment to Tackle Campus Housing Crunch
item.description: Dartmouth College is investing more than $500 million in its campus over the next five years to tackle a local-housing shortage.

item.title: Rival Crypto Market Emerges as Polymarket Registers $1 Billion in US Election Bets
item.description: The much talked about blockchain-powered prediction market Polymarket will soon have a new crypto-based competitor when it comes to making wagers on the US presidential election.

item.title: Shareholder Objects to Shell Pakistan’s Sale to Wafi Energy
item.description: A minority shareholder filed a complaint against Shell Plc’s unit in Pakistan over its sale to Saudi Arabia’s Wafi Energy Holding Ltd. earlier this year.

item.title: Germany’s Habeck Says Trade Conflict With China Must Be Averted
item.description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck urged the European Union and China to find a political solution in a dispute over Chinese-made electric vehicles and said a trade conflict should be avoided “at all costs.”

item.title: What’s at Stake in India’s Kashmir Regional Election?
item.description: Five years ago, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi stripped Jammu and Kashmir of the autonomy it had enjoyed for seven decades, downgrading the country’s only Muslim-majority province from a state to a federally-controlled territory.

item.title: US Industrial Production Rebounds After Hurricane-Related Drop
item.description: US industrial production rebounded in August from a Hurricane Beryl-related slide a month earlier, reflecting a pickup in manufacturing and mining output.

item.title: DOJ Fires Up Criminal Probe of Banks Hurt by Archegos Debacle
item.description: The US Justice Department is ramping up scrutiny of banks that collectively lost billions of dollars in the collapse of Bill Hwang’s investment firm — mere months after scoring a conviction against him for deceiving those very firms.

item.title: Saudi ETFs Tracking HK Shares Seen Raising Nearly $1 Billion
item.description: Two Saudi Arabian investment firms are set to launch exchange traded funds that will be the country’s first to track Hong Kong shares and are expected to raise close to $1 billion, offering the latest sign of growing ties between the oil rich kingdom and China.

item.title: Bond Traders Favor Half-Point Rate Cut Despite Retail Sales Data
item.description: Bond traders are favoring bets that Federal Reserve officials will kick off their interest-rate cutting cycle with a half-point move this week, undeterred by retail sales data.
